The actuarial (gain) loss recognized during the period is the adjustment out of other comprehensive income for actuarial (gains) losses recognized as a component of net periodic benefit cost during the period, after tax.

The net change in prior service cost (credit) occurring during the period, net of tax. This net change is the prior service cost arising during the period, offset by prior service cost recognized during the period. Prior service cost arising during the period is the cost of benefit improvement resulting from a plan amendment that occurred during the period, after tax. The plan amendment includes provisions that grant increased benefits based on services rendered in prior periods. The cost has not been recognized in net periodic benefit cost. This is offset by prior service cost recognized during the period, the adjustment out of other comprehensive income for prior service costs recognized as a component of net periodic benefit cost during the period, after tax.
